level.text: Criminal background check reports obtained under this section shall be confidential and are for the exclusive use of making employment-related determinations under this chapter. Private entities shall not release or otherwise disclose the reports to any person, except when:
Required as one component of an application for employment with the private entity;
Requested by the contracting officer or COTR during an official inspection or investigation;
Authorized by the written consent of the person being investigated;
Otherwise required by the contract; or
Utilized for a corrective or adverse action in a personnel proceeding, including but not limited to, an administrative action under section 502.10.

An individual who discloses confidential information in violation of this section is guilty of a criminal offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined not more than $1,000 or imprisoned for not more than 180 days, or both.
